leaflet.constituency: Kettering, Burton Latimer, Desborough, Rothwell and surrounding villages

messages.title: Three steps to a fairer Britain
messages.content:
1. A fair chance for every child - Lib Dems will invest in smaller class sizes, £2.5 billion extra for schools, and bring an end to university tuition fees.
2. A fair future: cut tax by £700 - and create jobs by making Britain greener - Lib Dems will cut most tax bills by £700 and create jobs by making Britain greener.
3. A fair deal from politicians - Make politicians accountable and give YOU the right to sack corrupt MPs.

messages.title: OUR NHS: AT RISK WITH THE CONSERVATIVES
messages.content: Tory Health spokesman accepted £21,000 donation from private health firm boss. David Cameron meets NHS privatisation campaigners. Key Tory MPs backed call to dismantle NHS.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Invest in smaller class sizes, provide £2.5 billion extra for schools, and end university tuition fees.
Cut most tax bills by £700 and create jobs by making Britain greener.
Make politicians accountable and give the public the right to sack corrupt MPs.

issues.economy: The Lib Dems are the only party with a plan to balance the country's books after the recession.
issues.education: A fair chance for every child - Lib Dems will invest in smaller class sizes, £2.5 billion extra for schools, and bring an end to university tuition fees.
issues.environment: Create jobs by making Britain greener.
issues.governance: Give YOU the right to sack corrupt MPs.
issues.health: OUR NHS: AT RISK WITH THE CONSERVATIVES - Tory Health spokesman accepted £21,000 donation from private health firm boss. David Cameron meets NHS privatisation campaigners. Key Tory MPs backed call to dismantle NHS.

quotes.text: We've lived through this mistake for 60 years now.... The reality is [the NHS] hasn't worked - it has made people ill...
quotes.source: Senior Conservative MEP Dan Hannan, Summer 2009

images.caption: Campaigning for Kettering, Chris Nelson - pictured with Lib Dem campaigners Chris McGlynn and Jehad Soliman - is committed to a fairer deal for Kettering constituency
